data.title: 32 famous British actors: From Tom Holland to Sam Claflin
data.meta_description: The UK boasts remarkable actors who shine with talent, humor, and charm. From Olivier to Day-Lewis, British actors are renowned worldwide. Stay tuned for the latest top 20 British actors.
data.text:
The United Kingdom has given the world some amazing actors. These actors not only steal the spotlight but also leave a lasting impact on their craft. British actors are cherished by audiences and fans for their humor, wit, charming accents, and often, their traditional manners.

Many British actors start their careers in theater and the West End, which gives them a unique edge. It makes them more skilled in their roles and more willing to take risks. Watching an experienced British actor bring a script to life is always a treat.

From the legendary Sir Laurence Olivier to today's brilliant Daniel Day-Lewis, these actors have left their mark on the global stage. This list is selective, including heavyweights like Nicholas Hoult, Tom Holland, Jim Broadbent, Sam Claflin, and more, all for their outstanding performances.

The list aims to stay up-to-date. Without further delay, here are the top 25 most popular British actors.

1. Nicholas Hoult

Birth name: Nicholas Caradoc Hoult

Date of Birth: December 7, 1989

Age: 33 years

Place of birth: Wokingham, Berkshire, England, UK

Profession: Model, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1996

Nicholas Hoult is a well-known actor famous for playing Hank McCoy in the X-Men movies. He started acting as a kid and appeared in shows like About a Boy, Holby City, and more.

His recent roles include Skins, Wallander, the X-Men series, Clash of the Titans, A Single Man, Tolkien, The Great, and Those Who Wish Me Dead. Hoult has also been nominated for awards like the BAFTAs, Golden Globes, and SAG awards.

Advertisement

Nicholas Hoult Popular Movies List:

Mad Max: Fury Road

The Favourite

Renfield

About a Boy

Warm Bodies

2. Jim Broadbent

Birth name: James Alan Broadbent

Date of Birth: May 24, 1949

Age: 74 years

Place of birth: Lincoln, Lincolnshire, England, UK

Profession: Screenwriter, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1971

Jim Broadbent, a renowned actor, is best remembered as Professor Slughorn in Harry Potter. He's not just about comedy; he's won Oscars, Golden Globes, and BAFTAs for his dramatic talent. In the early 80s, Brits knew him from Only Fools and Horses.

He's been in many great films like Time Bandits, Bridget Jones's Diary, and Hot Fuzz. He's also played serious roles in movies like The Gathering Storm and The Iron Lady. He's a versatile actor loved by audiences on both sides of the Atlantic.

Jim Broadbent Popular Movies List:

Brazil

Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Cloud Atlas

Gangs of New York

Moulin Rouge! (2001)

3. Kit Harington

Advertisement

Birth name: Christopher Catesby Harington

Date of Birth: December 26, 1986

Age: 36 years

Place of birth: London, England, UK

Profession: Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2012

Kit Harington, whose full name is Christopher Catesby Kit Harington, is an actor. His parents are Deborah Jane Catesby and Sir David Harington, who hold the title of the 15th Baronet of Ridlington. He got into acting through theater and West End plays. Then, he appeared in TV shows and movies in smaller roles.

But what really made him famous was when he played Jon Snow in Game of Thrones. He also had important roles in other things like How To Train Your Dragon, Gunpowder, Testament of Youth, Pompeii, and the Marvel Cinematic Universe's Eternals.

In his personal life, Kit Harington married Rose Leslie, who he met while working on Game of Thrones. They dated, got married, and recently became parents to their first child.

Kit Harington Popular Movies List:

Advertisement

Gunpowder

Testament of Youth

Pompeii

Game of Thrones

Eternals

4. Paul Bettany

Birth name: Paul Bettany

Date of Birth: May 27, 1971

Age: 52 years

Place of birth: Harlesden, London, England, UK

Profession: Director, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1994

Paul Bettany became famous for his roles as J.A.R.V.I.S. and Vision in the Iron Man and Avengers movies. He's acted in a wide range of films, from comedies to suspense, and even sci-fi. You might recognize him from movies like A Knight's Tale, The Tourist, and Solo: A Star Wars Story. He's also been in TV shows like WandaVision.

Paul Bettany is known for his sarcastic humor and his straightforward way of talking. He's set to appear in two new projects called The Harvest Moon and The Collaboration.

Paul Bettany Popular Movies List:

8 Iron Man 3

7 Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World

6 Avengers: Infinity War

5 Margin Call

4 Captain America: Civil War

5. John Boyega

Birth name: John Adedayo Bamidele Adegboyega

Date of Birth: March 17, 1992

Age: 31 years

Place of birth: Peckham, London, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2005

John Boyega, a famous actor and producer, is recognized as one of the top 100 influential black artists by New African magazine. He first became well-known in Britain for his role in the movie Attack the Block, which was a mix of sci-fi, comedy, and horror.

Advertisement

But what really made him a household name was his role as Finn in the Star Wars series. You might remember him from The Force Awakens, The Last Jedi, and Rise of the Skywalker.

Apart from Star Wars, he's been in other cool movies like Imperial Dreams, Pacific Rim: Uprising, and Detroit. He's also been part of TV shows like 24: Live Another Day and Small Axe.

John Boyega Popular Movies List:

Watership Down

Breaking

Detroit

Attack the Block

Star Wars: The Last Jedi

6. Jason Statham

Birth name: Jason Statham

Date of Birth: July 26, 1967

Age: 56 years

Place of birth: Shirebrook, Derbyshire, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1998

Jason Statham, the action star, started training in karate, Chinese martial arts, and kickboxing when he was young. He's not just tough; he's also a skilled diver and footballer. In 1990, he even represented England in the Commonwealth Games as a diver.

After that, he got into modeling and worked for big brands like French Connection, Tommy Hilfiger, and Levi's. But his big break came in the movies with Guy Ritchie's Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.

You've probably seen him in action-packed films like the Transporter series, The Bank Job, The Italian Job, Spy, The Expendables series, Hobbs & Shaw, 13, Crank, The Mechanic, and many more.

Advertisement

Jason Statham Popular Movies List:

The Fate of the Furious

The Mechanic

Snatch

Parker

The Transporter

7. Orlando Bloom

Birth name: Orlando Jonathan Blanchard Copeland Bloom

Date of Birth: January 13, 1977

Age: 46 years

Place of birth: Canterbury, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1994

Orlando Bloom is famous for playing Legolas in Lord of the Rings and reprising the role in The Hobbit. He's also known as Will Turner in Pirates of the Caribbean. In addition to these, he acted as Balian of Ibelin in the Kingdom of Heaven, Prince Paris in Troy, and in shows like Carnival Row, The Outpost, and Extras.

He also appeared in TV series like The Good Doctor, Midsomer Murders, The Prince, and movies like Needle in The Timestack.

Orlando Bloom Popular Movies List:

Kingdom of Heaven

Troy

Elizabethtown

Black Hawk Down

The Good Doctor

8. Sean Bean

Birth name: Shaun Mark Bean

Date of Birth: April 17, 1959

Age: 64 years

Place of birth: Handsworth, Sheffield, U K

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1984

Sean Bean is known for playing characters who often meet unfortunate ends. He was Boromir in The Lord of The Rings and met his end in the first movie. He also portrayed Ned Stark in Game of Thrones, the head of the Stark family, but he didn't last long in the show.

Aside from those roles, Sean Bean has been in many other notable projects. These include Troy, Sharpe, Silent Hill, Snowpiercer, National Treasure, Patriot Games, The Martian, Goldeneye, Curfew, World on Fire, Medici, Black Death, Time, Wolf Walker, Hitman 3, The Oath, Hitman 2, and more.

Sean Bean Popular Movies List:

National Treasure

The Island

Patriot Games

Black Death

The Hitcher

9. Martin Freeman

Birth name: Martin John Christopher Freeman

Date of Birth: September 8, 1971

Age: 51 years

Place of birth: Aldershot, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1997

Martin Freeman, known for his role as Bilbo Baggins in The Hobbit trilogy, also starred as Dr. Watson in the TV series Sherlock. He gained fame in roles like a British agent in Avengers: Civil War and Black Panther. Freeman's diverse career includes TV series like Fargo and The Office (UK version), as well as movies like Hitchhiker's Guide To the Galaxy and Shaun of the Dead. He's been part of Ali G, Inda House, and The Responders too.

Martin Freeman Popular Movies List:

The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey

Black Panther

The Office

Breeders

Hot Fuzz

Advertisement

10. Daniel Radcliffe

Birth name: Daniel Jacob Radcliffe

Date of Birth: July 23, 1989

Age: 34 years

Place of birth: London, U K

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1999

Daniel Radcliffe, the actor who portrayed Harry Potter as a child, remains recognizable for this role even after the series concluded. Besides Harry Potter, he's taken up roles in various smaller movies like Horns, The Lost City, Guns Akimbo, Jungle, Swiss Army Man, and more. Some other notable works include Kill Your Darlings, Escape From Pretoria, and Miracle Workers. He's also been part of The Woman in Black, Extras, and A Young Doctor's Notebook & Other Stories.

Daniel Radcliffe Popular Movies List:

The Woman in Black

Swiss Army Man

Harry Potter And The Philosopher's Stone

Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

The F Word

11. Tom Holland

Birth name: Thomas Stanley Holland

Date of Birth: June 1, 1996

Age: 27 years

Place of birth: Kingston upon Thames, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2010

Tom Holland started ballet classes, and his teacher suggested he try out for a role in Billy Elliot: The Musical. He loved acting and played that role until 2010. Later, he acted in movies like The Impossible, In The Heart of The Sea, and How I Live Now.

In 2016, he became Spider-Man in Captain America: Civil War. He played Spider-Man in five movies, breaking Tobey Maguire's record. After Marvel, he starred in Chaos Walking, The Devil All The Time, Cherry, and Uncharted, among others.

Tom Holland Popular Movies List:

Spider-Man: Homecoming

Spider-Man: Far From Home

Onward

Cherry

Uncharted

12. Michael Caine

Birth name: Sir Michael Caine

Date of Birth: March 14, 1933

Age: 90 years

Place of birth: Rotherhithe, London, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1946

Michael Caine, the legendary British actor, has been in the movie business for over 70 years and acted in a whopping 160 films. He's won two Academy Awards and a bunch of other important awards like Golden Globes, BAFTA, and SAG Awards. He's special because he got nominated for an Oscar in five different decades.

Some of his best movies include Zulu, Alfie, The Italian Job, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, Dressed to Kill, Educating Rita, Hannah And Her Sisters, Secondhand Lions, The Cider House Rules, The Quiet American, Quills, and the famous Dark Knight trilogy.

Michael Caine Popular Movies List:

The Prestige

Get Carter

The Dark Knight

Zulu

Batman Begins

13. Jamie Dornan

Birth name: James Peter Maxwell Dornan

Date of Birth: May 1, 1982

Age: 41 years

Place of birth: Belfast, Northern Ireland, UK

Profession: Model, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2006

Advertisement

Jamie Dornan first became famous as a model, working for big names like Hugo Boss, Dior Homme, and Calvin Klein. Vogue even ranked him among the top 25 male models ever.

Afterward, he moved into acting, starting with a role in the movie Marie Antoinette. He also appeared in TV shows like Once Upon A Time and The Fall.

But his big break came when he starred as Christian Grey in the Fifty Shades trilogy. Even though he's done great work in other movies like Anthropoid, The Siege of Jadotville, A Private War, and Belfast, he's still most famous for his role as Christian Grey.

Jamie Dornan Popular Movies List:

Fifty Shades Darker

Anthropoid

Wild Mountain Thyme

A Private War

Fifty Shades of Grey

14. Simon Pegg

Birth name: Simon John Pegg

Date of Birth: February 14, 1970

Age: 53 years

Place of birth: Gloucester, Gloucestershire, England, UK

Profession: Writer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1995

Simon Pegg, a British comedian, and actor, is known for his hilarious and iconic roles. You might recognize his voice as Buck in Ice Age, and he's also been in Mission Impossible as Benji Dunn and in Star Trek as Scotty, the engineer.

As an actor and writer, he's been part of great films like Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz, Star Trek Beyond, The World's End, Paul, and more. He's even appeared in Run Fatboy Run. Simon Pegg is a true talent in the world of comedy and movies.

Simon Pegg Popular Movies List:

The Adventures of Tintin

Ready Player One

Paul

The 'Star Trek' Trilogy

The 'Mission Impossible' Franchise

15. Sam Claflin

Birth name: Samuel George Claflin

Date of Birth: June 27, 1986

Age: 37 years

Place of birth: Ipswich, Suffolk, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2010

Sam Claflin is a British actor. He's known for his roles in The Hunger Games and Me Before You. Claflin was born on June 27, 1986, in Ipswich, England. He studied acting at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. His breakthrough came in 2011 when he played Finnick Odair in The Hunger Games series. He's also starred in Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides and Snow White and the Huntsman. Claflin's versatility and talent have made him a respected actor in Hollywood. Off-screen, he's known for his philanthropic efforts, supporting various charitable causes.

Sam Claflin Popular Movies List:

Me Before You

Adrift

Enola Holmes

Every Breath You Take

Love Wedding Repeat

16. Ewan McGregor

Advertisement

Birth name: Ewan Gordon McGregor

Date of Birth: March 31, 1971

Age: 52 years

Place of birth: Perth, Perthshire, Scotland, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1993

Ewan McGregor, a Scottish actor, gained fame in Danny Boyle's Trainspotting. He became Obi-Wan Kenobi in the Star Wars prequels in 1999, a role that soared in popularity. McGregor's talents shone in the Oscar-nominated Moulin Rouge in 2001. He starred in hits like Robots, Big Fish, and Doctor Sleep. Notable roles include Beauty and The Beast, The Ghost Writer, and Christopher Robin. He also reprised Obi-Wan Kenobi and impressed in Fargo. McGregor's diverse filmography includes Salmon Fishing in Yemen and Black Mass. With a successful career spanning decades, he remains a prominent figure in Hollywood.

Ewan McGregor Popular Movies List:

Trainspotting

Moulin Rouge

Big Fish

Black Hawk Down

Beginners

17. Hugo Weaving

Birth name: Hugo Wallace Weaving

Date of Birth: April 4, 1960

Age: 63 years

Place of birth: Ibadan, Nigeria

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British-Australian

Years active: 1980

Hugo Wallace Weaving, born in colonial Nigeria and raised in Australia, gained early recognition as Douglas Jardin in the cricket film Bodyline. However, it was 1999 that catapulted him to stardom. That year, he assumed the iconic role of Agent Smith in the Matrix trilogy.

Around the same time, he also portrayed the Tolkien elf, Elrond, in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, a role he reprised in the 2014 Hobbit trilogy. Weaving's versatility shone through in various hits like Priscilla: The Queen of the Desert, V for Vendetta, and Captain America: The First Avenger.

His compelling performances, including his distinctive portrayal of Agent Smith's menace and Elrond's regal wisdom, earned him a solid place in Hollywood. Hugo Weaving's career is a testament to his acting prowess and adaptability across diverse genres.

Hugo Weaving Popular Movies List:

The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert

Proof

V for Vendetta

The Matrix

18. Tom Hardy

Birth name: Edward Thomas Hardy

Date of Birth: September 15, 1977

Age: 45 years

Place of birth: Hammersmith, London, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2001

Tom Hardy began his career as a model, winning a contract with Model One Agency. Later, he shifted to acting. He was featured in notable works like Black Hawk Down, Band of Brothers, and Star Trek Nemesis. His roles in Marie Antoinette, RocknRolla, and Bronson also garnered attention.

Hardy's breakthrough came as Bane in Dark Knight Rises, along with roles in Inception, This Means War, and Lawless. He gained further fame in Mad Max Fury Road. In 2015, he starred in the Oscar-nominated movie The Revenant. His portfolio expanded with Venom, Dunkirk, Venom: Let There Be Carnage and appearances in Peaky Blinders.

Tom Hardy Popular Movies List:

Locke

The Dark Knight Rises

Venom

Inception

Dunkirk

19. Sacha Baron Cohen

Birth name: Sacha Noam Baron Cohen

Date of Birth: October 13, 1971

Age: 51 years

Place of birth: Hammersmith, London, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1995

Sacha Baron Cohen is a British comedian, actor, and writer. He's famous for creating unique characters like Ali G, Borat, and Bruno. These characters often interact with real people, bringing humor and satire to social and political issues. Cohen's work pushes boundaries and challenges norms. Borat, his notable character, got a film adaptation in 2006 and a sequel in 2020. His performances aim to expose societal absurdities and prejudices. Beyond characters, Cohen has acted in serious roles too, earning acclaim. He's won Golden Globe awards and been an Oscar nominee. Cohen's impact on comedy and culture is significant. His fearless approach continues to provoke thought and laughter.

Sacha Baron Cohen Popular Movies List:

Sweeny Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street

Bruno

The Spy

The Trial of The Chicago

Les Miserables

20. Tom Hiddleston

Birth name: John Adedayo Bamidele Adegboyega

Date of Birth: February 9, 1981

Age: 42 years

Place of birth: Westminster, London, England, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 2001

Tom Hiddleston is famous for playing Loki in the Thor and Avengers movies. He started his career in British theater, even winning an award for a play called Cymbeline.

He's been in many films like I Saw The Light, Kong: Skull Island, The Deep Blue Sea, and more. One of his standout roles was in a show called The Night Manager.

But what really made him a big deal was when he got his own show called Loki, where he played the lead character for the first time. A lot of people became his fans because of that.

Tom Hiddleston Popular Movies List:

Kong: Skull Island

Thor

Midnight in Paris

War Horse

Only Lovers Left Alive

21. Christian Bale

Birth name: Christian Charles Philip Bale

Date of Birth: January 30, 1974

Age: 49 years

Place of birth: Pembrokeshire, Wales, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active:1986

Christian Bale is a really skilled and well-liked actor of his time. Some of his recent movies that got nominated for big awards are Vice, Ford vs Ferrari, The Fighter, American Hustle, The Machinist, American Psycho, and more.

He even won an award for his role in The Fighter. He started acting when he was young and became famous for his part in Steven Spielberg's Children of the Sun.

He was also in The Newsies, Reign of Fire, the Dark Knight trilogy, Public Enemies, Out of the Furnace, Exodus: Gods and Kings, The Equilibrium, and others.

Christian Bale Popular Movies List:

The Dark Knight (2008) ·

The Prestige (2006) ·

American Psycho (2000) ·

The Dark Knight Rises (2012) ·

The Big Short (2015)

22. Bob Hoskins

Birth name: Robert William Hoskins

Date of Birth: 26 October 1942

Age: 26 October 1942 – 29 April 2014

Place of birth: Bury St. Edmund's, Suffolk, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1968–2012

Bob Hoskins was a hardworking individual who unexpectedly became famous for playing the main character, a tough detective, in the popular animated movie 'Who Framed Roger Rabbit'. He never lost touch with his humble beginnings and kept acting in small independent films like 'A Room For Romeo Brass', a special movie by Shane Meadows. Tragically, he passed away in 2014.

Bob Hoskins Popular Movies List:

The Long Good Friday

Mona Lisa

Who Framed Roger Rabbit

Super Mario Bros

Hook

23. Dirk Bogarde

Birth name: Sir Dirk Bogarde

Date of Birth: 28 March 1921

Age: 28 March 1921 – 8 May 1999

Place of birth: West Hampstead, London, United Kingdom

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1939–1990

Dirk Bogarde was a versatile actor who could tackle a wide range of roles. He could be the charming leading man in romantic films like the Doctor series, where he added a dash of humor and naughtiness. But he could also transform into a cunning working-class valet in a movie called 'The Servant.'

One of his most significant roles was in a movie called 'Victim,' where he played a lawyer who was struggling with his own feelings. This was a groundbreaking moment because Dirk Bogarde became the first big British actor to portray a gay character on the movie screen.

Dirk Bogarde Popular Movies List:

A Bridge Too Far

Parkinson

Death in Venice

The Night Porter

The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson

24. Michael Caine

Birth name: Sir Michael Caine

Date of Birth: 14 March 1933

Age: 90 years

Place of birth: St Olave's Hospital, London, UK

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1950–present

Michael Caine is a famous actor from London, and he's probably one of the most well-known Londoners ever. His career really took off in the 1960s when he starred in movies like 'Zulu' and 'Alfie.' These films made him a symbol of regular, working-class people in Britain.

As he got older, Caine started doing roles where he kind of poked fun at himself and the image he had built. He played what you might call "cheeky-chappie" characters, which means guys who are a bit mischievous and charming.

But the most incredible part of his career came when he teamed up with director Christopher Nolan. They worked together on some really amazing movies, and this collaboration brought Caine back into the spotlight in a big way, even though he was older. It's like he had a fantastic second act in his career.

Michael Caine Popular Movies List:

The Prestige

The Italian Job

Zulu

The Dark Knight

Batman Begins

25. Robert Carlyle

Birth name: Robert Carlyle OBE

Date of Birth: 14 April 1961

Age: 62 years

Place of birth: Maryhill, Glasgow, United Kingdom

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1990–present

Robert Carlyle is a talented Scottish actor known for his roles in movies like "Trainspotting" and TV shows like "Once Upon a Time." He's got this incredible ability to transform into different characters, like a chameleon changing colors. Imagine him as a blank canvas, and with his acting skills, he becomes anyone the script demands. From a ruthless villain to a charming hero, he does it all. His performances are like a rollercoaster ride for our emotions. So, if you're looking for an actor who can make you believe in the story, Carlyle is your guy.

Robert Carlyle Popular Movies List:

Trainspotting

Priest

The Full Monty

Hitler: The Rise of Evil

To End All Wars

26. John Cleese

Birth name: John Marwood Cleese

Date of Birth: 27 October 1939

Age: 83 years

Place of birth: Weston-super-Mare, United Kingdom

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1990–present

John Cleese is a British comedian, actor, and writer known for his witty humor. He's famous for co-founding the comedy group Monty Python and starring in their TV show and movies. Cleese's comedy is clever and often silly, making people laugh by poking fun at everyday situations. His distinctive voice and tall stature add to his memorable presence. Cleese's work has had a big influence on modern comedy, inspiring many comedians today. Whether it's his hilarious sketches or roles in movies like "A Fish Called Wanda," John Cleese's humor continues to bring joy to people around the world.

John Cleese Popular Movies List:

Rat Race

The World is not Enough

The Meaning of Life

Monty Python and The Holy Grail

Life of Brain

27. Sean Connery

Birth name: Sir Thomas Sean Connery

Date of Birth: 25 August 1930

Age: 1930-2020

Place of birth: Fountainbridge, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Profession: Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1954–2007 2012

Sean Connery's journey from a Glasgow milkman to becoming one of the most famous British actors in the world is a tale of unwavering determination and a bit of stubbornness. He's still the beloved James Bond for many fans, and he brought a captivating allure to the role. But what makes him even more impressive is that he didn't just stick to flashy action movies; he also showed his acting chops in serious films like 'The Hill' and Hitchcock's 'Marnie'.

Sean Connery Popular Movies List:

Dragonheart

The Russia House

The Untouchables

Outland

The Wind and the Lion

28. Benedict Cumberbatch

Birth name: Benedict Timothy Carlton Cumberbatch

Date of Birth: 19 July 1976

Age: 47 years

Place of birth: Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospital, London, United Kingdom

Profession: Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1998–present

Benedict Cumberbatch is a fantastic actor known for his ability to convincingly portray highly intelligent characters. He's from London and has starred in various roles, showcasing his talent. You might remember him as Sherlock Holmes in the BBC series 'Sherlock' or as Doctor Strange in the movies. He's not just limited to playing smart characters, though.

In a recent film called 'The Power of the Dog,' he gave an impressive performance that really grabs your attention. And if you've seen him in the Showtime series 'Patrick Melrose,' you'll know he can play a troubled character just as convincingly. In a way, he's like Sherlock himself, there doesn't seem to be much he can't do when it comes to acting.

Benedict Cumberbatch Popular Movies List:

Good Omens

The Simpsons

Sherlock

Spider-Man: No Way Home

Avengers: Endgame

29. Charles Dance

Birth name: Walter Charles Dance

Date of Birth: 10 October 1946

Age: 76 years

Place of birth: Redditch, United Kingdom

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1971–present

Charles Dance is a distinguished British actor known for his roles in popular TV shows and movies like "Game of Thrones" and "Alien 3." He's often recognized for his commanding presence and deep, resonant voice. In simple terms, he's a professional actor who's really good at his job. People admire him for his talent and versatility in bringing fictional characters to life on screen. Whether he's playing a cunning nobleman or a sinister villain, Charles Dance's performances are captivating, making him a well-respected figure in the entertainment world.

Charles Dance Popular Movies List:

Alien

The Imitation Game

Me Before You

Last Action Hero

Gosford Park

30. Idris Elba

Birth name: Idrissa Akuna Elba

Date of Birth: 6 September 1972

Age: 50 years

Place of birth: London Borough of Hackney, London, United Kingdom

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1994–present

Idris Elba is a talented British actor known for his roles in movies like "Thor" and TV shows like "Luther." He's got that cool British accent, but he's not just an actor; he's also a DJ and musician! You might have seen him as the charming Heimdall in the Marvel films, or solving crimes as the brilliant detective John Luther. Idris is a versatile actor, which means he can play all sorts of different characters. Plus, he's got a great sense of style and is known for being a really down-to-earth guy. So, if you're a fan of movies and TV, Idris Elba is definitely someone you should know about!

Idris Elba Popular Movies List:

The Suicide Squad

Star Trek Beyond

Thor Franchise

American Gangster

Zootopia

31. Colin Firth

Birth name: Colin Andrew Firth

Date of Birth: 10 September 1960

Age: 62 years

Place of birth: Grayshott, United Kingdom

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1983–present

Colin Firth, the British actor known for his roles in movies like "The King's Speech" and "Bridget Jones's Diary," has a knack for bringing characters to life on the big screen. He's like a chameleon, changing his appearance, voice, and mannerisms to fit each role perfectly. Firth's talent lies in his ability to make us believe he is the character he's playing, whether it's a stammering king or a charming romantic lead. His performances are so genuine that they draw us into the story, making us forget we're watching an actor. That's the magic of Colin Firth in a nutshell.

Colin Firth Popular Movies List:

Bridget Jones's Diary

1917

Shakespeare in Love

A Single Man

Kingsman: The Secret Service

32. Michael Gambon

Birth name: Sir Michael John Gambon

Date of Birth: 19 October 1940

Age: 82 years

Place of birth: Cabra, Ireland

Profession: Producer, Actor

Nationality: British

Years active: 1962–present

Michael Gambon is a talented actor widely known for his roles in movies and television. He's like a chameleon, transforming into various characters. You might recognize him as Professor Dumbledore in the Harry Potter series. Gambon's acting is so believable, it's like he becomes the character. Just as a painter creates unique art, Gambon crafts unique performances. He's a star, but his success comes from hard work and dedication, not copying others. Like a fingerprint, his acting is one-of-a-kind. So, remember, originality is key, and Michael Gambon shows us how to shine by being true to ourselves.
